data.showtitle: Return of the Curse of Timeland
data.shownotes: This show was billed as Return of the Curse of Timeland (a rescheduling of their cancelled 2021 New Year's Eve Timeland Festival) and featured the debuts of Magenta Mountain, The Garden Goblin, The Dripping Tap, and Soy-Protein Munt Machine. Timeland was played over the PA as the pre-show music. A model of London’s Big Ben clock tower, approximately 20 ft (6 m) tall, with the words “Time is Ephemeral” and “Music is Ephemeral” written on the clock’s face was erected in the back right corner of the stage.  The clock hands ran forward at an accelerated pace throughout the show.  Am I in Heaven? contained Rattlesnake teases and Boogieman Sam quotes/teases. Evil Death Roll contained Robot Stop teases. Trapdoor was played for the first time known since 2016-09-09. (259 show gap) The Dripping Tap was introduced as a song about a tap that won’t stop dripping.  Smoke & Mirrors was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Hot Wax was played for the first time since 2018-06-20. (114 show gap) Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Rattlesnake contained Boogieman Sam quotes and featured another Cavs drum solo, during which the band destroyed the clock tower presiding over the stage and passed out the pieces into the crowd. The on-stage carnage appears to have extended to some of the band’s equipment, as the final portion of Rattlesnake was performed with Joey playing the FMB and Stu singing with no instrument.
data.opener: Babe Rainbow, Stonefield, Ajak Kwai, Nice Biscuit, Bones & Jones w/Folk BItch Trio

data.jamchart_notes: Still in its infancy, this "Tap" bears witness to an inspired Stu dueting on flute with Cecil Coleman (Body Type) for a little "flute jam." Some nice harmonic interplay and Am I In Heaven?-style vamping ensues before a bevy of proper teases and quotes in the customary energetic run up to the coda.
data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Blame It On the Weather. I’m Not In Your Mind contained Rattlesnake teases and Boogieman Sam quotes. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Mystery Jack was introduced as the oldest song that would be played that night, followed by a tease of “Frankenstein” (Edgar Winter Group). Mystery Jack was played for the first time since 2018-11-24 (86 show gap). Ataraxia was on the written setlist but was replaced by Doom City. Following O.N.E. opening band Body Type was shouted out. The Dripping Tap featured a “flute jam” duet between Stu and Cecil Coleman of Body Type and contained Pill teases and Cellophane teases/quotes.
Hell was introduced as a song about L.A.  Automation was introduced as a song about the near-term future.

I’m Not In Your Mind and Sea of Trees contained The Dripping Tap teases. Gaia featured a drum solo. Work This Time, which featured a guitar solo, was dedicated to Joey’s partner Edith (Amby’s sister), who briefly appeared on stage.  The Dripping Tap was introduced by Amby as a song he wrote about his kitchen sink and contained Cellophane teases.   Straws in the Wind was dedicated to Cavs' nipples.  Joey shouted out Mildlife following Straws.  Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. teases/quotes, Automation teases and See Me quotes.

Nuclear Fusion was dedicated to Skrillex. Stu did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion at Joey’s request. SPELLLING and Amyl and the Sniffers were shouted out after Plastic Boogie. Her and I contained Iron Lung quotes and Slow Jam 1 quotes. Evil Death Roll contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Boogieman Sam was dedicated to Belgium (home of sound tech Gaspard Demulemeester) and contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes. Amby introduced The Dripping Tap as a song about his water bill.
data.venuename: Event Lawn at Virgin Hotels Las Vegas

data.shownotes: The show opened with an expression of disdain for the visiting New Orleans Pelicans of the NBA, who defeated the Phoenix Suns in a first-round playoff game earlier in the evening. Planet B was started and stopped several times before the full song was played. Honey contained Doom City teases. Sleep Drifter contained Billabong Valley quotes. The Bitter Boogie contained Presumptuous quotes and featured Stu feeding chips and salsa to the band and throwing chips out to the audience.

data.showtitle: Coachella Valley Music And Arts Festival
data.shownotes: The MOTU Suite was introduced as being about self-replicating robots turning the universe into vomit.  Following Predator X fellow festival acts Amyl & the Sniffers and The Chats were shouted out.  Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.

data.jamchart_notes: A super punchy and energetic version. Having achieved its now-trademark blistering speed, they further push the boundaries of the budding jam vehicle and take an offramp to (a then-unknown) Hell's Itch jam. A vocally inspired "drip drip" section gives way to the hottest "Tap" peak yet. Cavs is on fire!
data.shownotes: Superbug was introduced as a "song we wrote in 2019 about 2020". Wah Wah contained teases and quotes of The River. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Stevie Ray Vaughn, Jimi Hendrix, Steve Vai, John Butler, Joe Satriani, John Mayer and Korn were shouted out after Work This Time. Open Water featured a drum solo by Cavs and a Static Electricity tease. Straws in the Wind contained The Grim Reaper quotes. O.N.E. was introduced as "about being on tour". Boogieman Sam was dedicated to Sam, the band's sound tech, and contained quotes from Hate Dancin' and “La Grange” (ZZ Top). The Dripping Tap contained a Hell's Itch jam with lyrics and Hot Water teases.

Robot Stop had teases of Hot Water and People-Vultures. Before The Dripping Tap, Joey shouted out Trent Reznor of Nine Inch Nails, calling him "talented and hot", and Ambrose quoted "The Stroke" (Billy Squier). People-Vultures was on the printed setlist after Gamma Knife but not played.

Honey had teases from Billabong Valley and Sleep Drifter. Boogieman Sam had Cut Throat Boogie quotes. The Dripping Tap had I'm in your Mind quotes. After Honey, Stu says "give us that Tool beat", then says he was thinking of the wrong song and asks for that "Ginger Baker beat". Tezeta was played for the first time since 2019-10-07. (54 show gap) During Boogieman Sam, Stu was throwing some kind of food into the crowd, feeding it to the band, as well as tossing it in the air and catching it in his mouth.

data.jamchart_notes: This supersized version has lots of quality guitar noodling to extend its length, snappy Cavs, a thrilling "drip drip" stop-start crescendo, and most notably, an Iron Lung jam section
data.shownotes:
3 hour marathon set. Before the show, "Timeland" was played on the speakers. The intro to Nuclear Fusion was done by the band's sound tech Gaspard. Mr. Beat contained a Persistence tease. Billabong Valley contained a Sleep Drifter tease. During the setbreak, "Smoke & Mirrors" was also played via the venue's speakers. I'm Not In Your Mind contained a Dripping Tap tease. Gaia featured a drum solo. Cellophane featured Stu on flute. The River was dedicated to "Ambrose's ass" and the second segment was played faster per Stu's request. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Before The Dripping Tap, Stu shouted out the band's crew. The Dripping Tap contained Iron Lung quotes. Mystery Jack was on the setlist after The River, but not played due to time constraints. 

Poster By Jake Foreman

Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer was played for the first time since 12-11-17 (178 show gap) and had Ambrose on sax. The Dripping Tap was dedicated to "the moms". "Let's Go Crazy" (Prince) was quoted before The Dripping Tap. The Bitter Boogie featured "Sexual Healing" (Marvin Gaye) quotes, as well as Ambrose on sax. Evil Death Roll was on the setlist after I'm In Your Mind Fuzz, but not performed. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer, The Dripping Tap, and The Bitter Boogie have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show featured the debut of both Presumptuous and The Grim Reaper. Her and I contained an Am I In Heaven? intro, Presumptuous quotes, and an Iron Lung jam with lyrics. Presumptuous was introduced as being "like what Santana sounds like in 2022." Sea of Trees contained alternate lyrics ("ignore it" instead of "unfold") and The Dripping Tap and Head On/Pill teases. Hot Water contained Shanghai teases. The Grim Reaper was introduced as a song about a time Ambrose's neighbor believed that devils were chasing her.

Before The Dripping Tap, Joey chanted "Turn it up Sammy". I'm In Your Mind was introduced as a song about getting a new haircut, followed by a short riff being played. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Rattlesnake and Am I In Heaven? teases. Evil Death Roll contained Lord of Lightning, The Dripping Tap, Converge, and Shanghai teases. Down The Sink was played for the first time since 2019-10-16 (55 show gap). Rattlesnake contained Minimum Brain Size, Automation, O.N.E, Nuclear Fusion, Sleep Drifter, Honey, and Static Electricity teases and quotes. During the Honey tease the crowed began chanting "Honey".
data.soundcheck: Down the Sink, Presumptuous, The Grim Reaper, The Balrog

data.shownotes: 2nd show with Cavs unable to play due to getting COVID. The band played with a drum machine, this time with no CAVS shirt. Magenta Mountain opened with a drum machine jam by Stu. Sadie Sorceress contained a lengthened intro where the band and crowd shouted Cavs. After Most Of What I Like, the band joked they would play Organ Farmer and Gaia with the drum machine next. Slow Jam 1 contained Iron Lung quotes and teases. O.N.E. contained a Honey tease. Muddy Water and Float Along Fill Your Lungs were on the printed setlist at the end, but were cut.

This was the first of five nights in Barcelona for Primavera Sound. Honey contained Sleep Drifter and Rattlesnake teases. The printed setlist contained a different song order - 'Self-Immolate' first and 'Mars for the Rich' second. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Gaia through Honey, Magenta Mountain, and The Dripping Tap have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap, Muddy Water, Sea of Trees and Hot Water teases. The Garden Goblin was on the written setlist but was not played. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The Dripping Tap contained a Cellophane tease. During The Dripping Tap, Stu crowd-surfed into the lake adjacent to the stage after saying "I think it's a nice day for a swim". Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Crumbling Castle and The Dripping Tap have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show was part of the 2022 Bonnaroo Music & Arts Festival and was held in “That Tent”. Robot Stop was played as an homage to the live debut of Robot Stop at Bonnaroo in 2015 and contained Hot Water teases. Following Planet B, Joey shouted out Tool, who was also playing at the festival (but on a different day to his chagrin) and then teased The Grudge (Tool). Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Magenta Mountain contained Crumbling Castle teases. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. The Dripping Tap contained Dazed and Confused (Led Zeppelin) teases. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live at Bonnaroo ‘22.

This show was the final show of the US leg of the band's 2022 spring/summer world tour. The River was dedicated to Michael Bay and contained Wah Wah teases. After The River, the band shouted out their crew. Sadie Sorceress featured a guitar solo and contained quotes from The Grim Reaper.

The Grim Reaper was introduced as a song about Michael Flatley's post-show warmdown. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Gaia and The Grim Reaper have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Raining Blood (Slayer) played before and as the band came on stage. The River [1] contained Wah Wah teases and parts I, II, & III were played before transitioning to Wah Wah, which contained The River teases and quotes. Part IV of the The River was played after Road Train. Ambergris was introduced as having slap bass. After Ambergris, Joey shouts out opener Grace Cummings. Slow Jam 1 contained an Iron Lung vocal jam and Witchcraft teases. Ataraxia was introduced as "Tanaraxia", which was explained to be a song about Joey wanting to be tan. Sleep Drifter contained a Doom City and Billabong Valley tease. Float Along – Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Poster by Bjenny Montero Edition of 100

data.jamchart_notes: A more melodious jam than the Best Kept Secret “Tap” accompanies Stu’s (now customary?) Lake Perris plunge. Amby rips some harmonica, improvises some lyrics, and then implores the crowd: “Can we have our singer back on the stage?” It would be a mistake to dismiss this fun, funny, and creative version as a mere retread!
data.shownotes: This show was part of the 2022 Desert Daze Festival (held on Moreno Beach at the Lake Perris State Recreation Area) and featured the live debut of Iron Lung. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. Boogieman Sam contained Cut Throat Boogie, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, and “My Babe” (Little Walter) quotes. Following Murder of the Universe the band shouted out Tame Impala, who also appeared at the festival. Following K.G.L.W. (Outro), Joey called out “our other best friends Mild High Club”, who were also playing that night, and Ambrose got them confused with Mildlife, another group the band was friends with playing the festival the next day. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs had a false start due to Stu's guitar being out of tune and contained a metal jam. The Dripping Tap was introduced as a song “about swimming in a sea of death”, and during the song Stu crowd surfed to and swam in Lake Perris, then crowd surfed back to the stage. The song contained Torture Chamber quotes.

This show featured the debut of Ice V. Wah Wah began with the intro to The River, and subsequently contained Crumbling Castle and The River teases. Ambrose quoted It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) before Doom City. O.N.E. began with the intro to Straws in the Wind instead of the customary intro. Pleura contained a quote of “Freedom” (Rage Against the Machine). Straws in the Wind was dedicated to Russell Brand. Smoke and Mirrors was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. Ambergris contained an Ice V tease. Before The Reticent Raconteur, Leah Senior was introduced to the stage as “The Original Balrog” and Joey gave a shoutout to her live bass player Jack [Robbins], with the bonus trivia that he was also in Stu’s first band Almacknjack. The Reticent Raconteur was played for the first time since 2021-02-24 (61 show gap). The Reticent Raconteur and The Lord of Lightning featured narration by Leah Senior. The Fourth Colour was played for the first time since 2019-11-23 (70 show gap). Am I in Heaven? contained The Dripping Tap teases. Poster by Jason Galea 800 standard / 50 Foil Print

data.jamchart_notes: A bloodcurdling scream, a hypertensive first jam, a hellish itch, and a Pill to cure all ills; this show-closing jam vessel travels far and wide with its bodily imagery. The Gizzy Boys’ rhythm section lock a tight grip on “drip drip” while Stu, Amby, and Joey rip (especially during the coda jam, holy “Tap”)!
data.shownotes:
This show featured the live debut of A New World. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Flamethrower teases, as well as Iron Lung quotes. The Grim Reaper featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress played over the music to The Grim Reaper followed by Sadie Sorceress quotes and teases. Ice V contained Slow Jam 1 quotes. A New World through Altered Beast II featured narration by Leah Senior. Altered Beast I was played for the first time since 2022-10-05 (90 show gap). Alter Me I and Altered Beast II were played for the first time since 2019-10-06 (87 show gap). Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Leah Senior was shouted out after Magma. The Dripping Tap contained Hypertension quotes and Hell’s Itch and Head On/Pill teases.

Poster by Jason Galea
320 Standard / 40 Foil Print

Stu and Ambrose wished Joey a happy birthday during The Dripping Tap. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Oddlife was introduced as “Cookie’s favorite song”. Boogieman Sam was dedicated to soundman Sam Joseph and contained Cut Throat Boogie teases/quotes, “My Babe” (Little Walter), “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes and Sleepwalker teases. Sea of Trees was introduced as “what King Gizzard was originally called” and “Lucas’s favorite song”, and contained Head On/Pill and The Bitter Boogie teases. Hypertension was played over the PA as the setbreak music, which incidentally served as the “debut” for the studio track. I’m Not in Your Mind contained Alter Me teases. A New World through Altered Beast III featured Leah Senior providing narration. Alter Me I contained an Altered Beast III tease. Alter Me II and Altered Beast III were played for the first time since 2019-10-07 (90 show gap). The intro to Iron Lung featured additional vocals about “hot buns”. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease. Iron Lung was reprised during Mr. Beat. Joey was hit with silly string at the conclusion of the show, and Ambrose quoted “Happy Birthday, Lisa” (The Simpsons) for the second night in a row. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea
Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Ambrose quoted “Evergreen” (Leah Senior) before The Dripping Tap. Poster By Jason Galea 230 Standard / 30 Foil

The show opened with a brief drum solo by Cavs prior to the rest of the band taking the stage. History owner (Drake) (“Champagne Papi”) was mentioned a number of times over the course of the show. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. and Automation quotes and teases. Ambrose crowd surfed while singing the refrain in Straws in the Wind. Joey introduced Anoxia as “my Neil Young impersonation song.” Ice V was introduced as being “in memory of Queen E.” Prior to Digital Black, Joey said "hello" numerous times in a Han-Tyumi impression. Soy-Protein Munt Machine and Vomit Coffin contained Hypertension teases. The Dripping Tap contained an I’m in Your Mind Fuzz Suite tease. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The recordings of this show are incomplete (missing Digital Black). KGLW.net staff do have enough to confirm the > into Han-Tyumi and that Ice V came to a full stop. For the show opening drum solo, it was discussed whether this should be added to the setlist as “Fury” in order to match with the show opening drum solo from the Melbourne ‘21 bootlegger release. It was decided that the drum solos labeled “Fury” by the band consist of a distinct double bass drum part which is absent from this drum solo and that other drum solos have been given different names (i.e. “Parking” on Chunky Shrapnel), therefore it was decided to leave this drum solo as a show note since we do not have definitive information on what it should be called. If anyone has any further information about these items, or ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Honey contained Sleep Drifter and Rattlesnake teases. The Sleep Drifter outro -> to O.N.E. contained Billabong Valley teases. Leah Senior and Black Midi were shouted out after O.N.E. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band, which also contained People-Vultures teases. After the solo, Joey lamented that they didn’t have another drum set to hold a drum battle between Cavs and Morgan of Black Midi. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases.

Posters By Jason Galea
Show: 555 Standard / 55 Foil Print
Record Fair: 100 Standard Print
data.soundcheck: Magenta Mountain w/ attempted > The Grim Reaper

data.jamchart_notes: Though not its usual immaculate, tight self, the Asheville “Tap” finds the band stretching out into new territory and mapping out “The Land Before Timeland”.
data.shownotes:
The show began with a drum solo leading into Venusian 2. Before Predator X, an “Asheville Gatherum” shirt was thrown on stage, and Stu changed into it. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Magenta Mountain teases. Magenta Mountain was dedicated to Robert “Bob” Moog, inventor of the Moog synthesizer. Nuclear Fusion featured Lucas on the intro vocal. Another t-shirt was thrown up on stage after Iron Lung; Stu thanked everyone for the t-shirts noting that “I fucking stink like shit so it’s perfect.” After Stu declared that “showers are for squares,” Ambrose then suggested that Stu had never had a shower in his life, “only golden ones.” Wah Wah contained a The River intro, as well as teases and quotes. The Dripping Tap contained The Land Before Timeland teases.

Poster By Lewy Jones

Rattlesnake contained Sleep Drifter teases. The outro to Sleep Drifter contained Honey quotes before returning to the earlier Rattlesnake jam. Before Pleura, the band shouted out The Murlocs (with Cavs filling in on drums) for killing it prior to their set. Before Gaia, it was noted that Fishing for Fishies had been recorded by Gareth Liddiard of Tropical Fuck Storm. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Before The Dripping Tap, Joey again shouted out The Murlocs, Leah Senior, and “Tropical Fuck Cunts”. KGLW.net Staff Notes: For those wondering about the nature of the show-opening Rattlesnake sequence, the band is jamming on Rattlesnake themes before an immediate and natural transition to Honey, which is immediately followed by a segue into Sleep Drifter that contains elements of Honey all the way through, and finally a return to the bridge and “Rattle, rattle, rattle” portion of the preceding Rattlesnake jam, thus completing the “Snake Sandwich”.

data.jamchart_notes: Lucas makes a rare assertive appearance in the second jam of this festival “Tap,” and Stu follows suit leading the band in a brief excursion into minor-key jamming that ultimately culminates in a neat “Hypertension” section, which spans both D minor and major as they work back to “drip drip.”
data.shownotes: This show was part of the 2022 Summer Haze Festival. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over the top of a metal vamp from the band. Ice V contained Hypertension teases. Stu threw water bottles into the crowd during Hot Water. Amusing banter before The Dripping Tap referenced the heat, sweating, church, God, Satan, weed, and vaping. The Dripping Tap subsequently contained Hypertension teases and quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The recording for this show is incomplete (missing Hypertension). Despite the incomplete recording, KGLW.net staff supports the -> transition from Ice V -> Hypertension based on available audio evidence of the start of the transition near the end of Ice V. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show was originally scheduled to be at Bowl of Brooklands, but was moved indoors to TSB Stadium due to weather. I’m Not in Your Mind contained The Dripping Tap teases and Alter Me teases and quotes. The River contained Happy Birthday to You quotes and eventually came to a full stop as Sam’s birthday was recognized by the band and crowd. Ice V subsequently contained The River teases. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. The Dripping Tap contained teases from the I’m In Your Mind Fuzz Suite before reprising Cellophane.

This show was originally scheduled to be at Bowl of Brooklands, but was moved indoors to TSB Stadium due to weather. I’m Not in Your Mind contained The Dripping Tap teases and Alter Me teases and quotes. The River contained Happy Birthday to You quotes and eventually came to a full stop as Sam’s birthday was recognized by the band and crowd. Ice V subsequently contained The River teases. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. The Dripping Tap contained teases from the I’m In Your Mind Fuzz Suite before reprising Cellophane.

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases. Slow Jam I contained Iron Lung teases. Opening acts The Prize and CLAMM were shouted out after Sense. Shanghai was introduced as being about a fight the band got into in Shanghai. Lava, Gamma Knife and People-Vultures were on the written setlist as the final three songs but were not played. Poster by Troppo Print Studio 200 Standard / 20 Foil Print
People-Vultures contained a “Down With the Sickness” (Disturbed) quote. Mr. Beat contained The Dripping Tap teases. Automation was dedicated to ChatGPT. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Oddlife was introduced as Cookie’s favorite song and contained Rattlesnake teases. Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases/quotes and featured a drum solo by Cavs. Following Gaia, Joey wished everyone a happy International Women’s Day. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases. The Dripping Tap was introduced by Amby as being about both his neverending fountain of youth and how one day he will quit music and become a plumber. Poster By Lewy Jones
data.soundcheck: Kepler-22b, Work This Time, Nuclear Fusion

data.shownotes: Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Sense was teased immediately before and during Ice V, which contained a Hypertension tease. Ambergris was introduced as “Joey’s porno song”. The Dripping Tap contained Hot Water teases and quotes with the lyrics changed to “time to party” and “everybody wants to party”, and Cellophane teases. Boogieman Sam contained “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat), “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “It's a Long Way to the Top (If You Wanna Rock 'N' Roll)” (AC/DC) quotes and Am I In Heaven? teases. Float Along – Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Poster By Lewy Jones

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases/quotes. Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly 'Lets Get Real High' jam. Work This Time contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote and featured a guitar solo. The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases. The River contained Iron Lung teases. Trapdoor was listed on the printed setlist after Muddy Water but was not played. Poster By Carlo Vivary

The Grim Reaper contained an extra verse from Sadie Sorceress. Shanghai was stopped midway through, eventually resuming with a Grow Wings and Fly 'Lets Get Real High' jam. The Bitter Boogie contained Crumbling Castle teases. Prior to Lava, a pocket watch was passed up to the stage and Stu attempted to find the owner. Lava contained Hypertension teases. Wah Wah contained The River teases/quotes. It’s Got Old was played for the first time since April 13, 2022 (84 show gap) and was introduced as “a very old song that will most likely be fucking awesome and very reggae-ish” as well as containing a Blindness (The Fall) jam. Ice V had the intro and first verse performed without drums and contained Hypertension teases. Prior to The Dripping Tap, Amby introduced the song as the story of his kitchen sink and Joey shouted out one of the front-of-stage security staff who had been dancing to the music. The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases and closed with Amby quoting “So Long, Farewell” (The Sound of Music). Poster By Drew Millward

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases/quotes and featured a drum solo by Cavs. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and The Dripping Tap teases/quotes. Hot Water contained The Dripping Tap teases and had lyrics changed to "time to party". The segue from Gamma Knife to Hypertension consisted of a full band outro of People-Vultures. Work This Time contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly jam. Amby shouted out Tame Impala after Shanghai. The Grim Reaper featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress and contained Horology teases. The Dripping Tap contained Am I in Heaven? teases, Cellophane teases, Head On/Pill teases, and a jam reminiscent of Mycelium.

This show was part of the 2023 Vintage Vibes Festival. Ice V contained Iron Lung quotes. Gaia contained a drum solo from Cavs. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases. Magenta Mountain was introduced as being about “mountains and stuff” and had lyrics changed to “I don’t believe Stu.” KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show has been confirmed, but only partial recordings exist. The full setlist was confirmed via the available recordings and written setlist for this show as well as contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations for missing or incomplete songs that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Amy Jean 100 Standard / 20 Foil

This show featured the debut of Converge.  Iron Lung was introduced as a song about vaping.  Self-Immolate was introduced as a song about setting yourself on fire and featured the return of the Holy Explorer to the stage.  Gaia was dedicated to Russell Crowe.  The show was stopped for several minutes during Gila Monster in order to find a missing person.

This show featured the debut of Supercell. The Dripping Tap contained Hot Water teases and Hypertension teases. Robot Stop contained The Dripping Tap teases. Gamma Knife and People-Vultures contained Motor Spirit teases/quotes. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases. Hypertension contained Witchcraft teases, Hot Water teases, and Robot Stop teases. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Special shout out to our very own @28rebounds for the recording located on Archive.org! Poster By Jason Galea 215 Standard / 80 Foil Print

The Dripping Tap was dedicated to Cavs’ father, Bill, “the best plumber in the world.” Satan Speeds Up was played for the first time known since November 15, 2014 (539 show gap), and contained a “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Shanghai featured the “let’s get real high” jam from Grow Wings and Fly. This Thing contained “Incredible” (M Beat) quotes. Most of What I Like was played fully electric for the first time. Previous performances were done acoustically and partially acoustic. See Most of What I Like. The Wheel and Evil Death Roll were switched on the physical setlist, but were swapped because "Amby wants to keep chilling". Evil Death Roll contained Iron Lung quotes. Following the show those attending both the early and late shows were allowed to stay in the venue and the band's new album PetroDragonic Apocalypse was played over the PA. KGLW.net Staff Notes: While it was widely believed that Satan Speeds Up had never been played live prior to this show; per Stu's comments a previously unnoted performance took place at the 2014 St. Kilda Festival (February 9, 2014). As there are no known recordings of the band's set at the 2014 St. Kilda Festival, if anyone has any information on what was played at the 2014 St. Kilda Festival show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea 2000 Standard / 500 Foil

This show featured the debut of Change. Plastic Boogie was played for the first time since June 5, 2022 (74 show gap) and contained a Black Dog (Led Zeppelin) outro. Prior to The Garden Goblin Joey teased the commercial theme for Bunnings Warehouse, an Australian home improvement store. The Garden Goblin was then introduced by Cookie as a song about the time his dog snuck into a Bunnings. The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases. Hot Wax was on the printed setlist but was not played. Hot Water and Hypertension were on the printed setlist after The Garden Goblin but were moved up to keep the band’s synth equipment out of the rain. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live in Chicago '23. KGLW.net staff note: There was much internal discussion as to a potential tease of the intro to Gondii in Change. The arrangement of instruments and structure of Change has been modified compared with the studio version. Though it resembles a tease of Gondii, we believe more live instances need to he heard to determine if this is intentional, or just an accentuation of the existing relationship between the songs. Poster By Jason Galea 460 Standard / 130 Foil

data.jamchart_notes: An atypical and jammy intro sees Ambrose wander into the crowd, from where he eventually begins the song. Following the first chorus, a lengthy minor key jam emerges that grows increasingly tense and dark. Quotes and teases of Crumbling Castle and Cellophane build up to an intense peak. Returning back to the second jam section, the band weaves Head On/Pill into a jam reminiscent of the Dead-inspired progressions that popped up throughout the summer. The longest version to date, and worth every minute.
data.shownotes:
Band sound tech Gaspard De Meulemeester was brought onstage to do the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion, which he did in French.  Honey contained Sleep Drifter teases. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. The Dripping Tap contained Crumbling Castle teases and quotes, Cellophane teases and quotes, Sea of Trees teases and Head On/Pill teases.

Poster By Jason Galea
420 Standard / 120 Foil

This was a three-hour marathon show and the first marathon show to be performed as a single set. The show opened with a video of Amby's father, Broderick Smith, introducing the band. Eyes Like the Sky through Evil Man was dedicated to Broderick Smith and featured Broderick’s narration from the Eyes Like the Sky album played over the PA while the band played, and photos of Broderick displayed on the large screen behind the band. Eyes Like the Sky, Year Of Our Lord, and The Raid were played for the first time since December 1, 2018 (192 show gap). Evil Man was played for the first time since February 18, 2016 (449 show gap). Prior to Gaia, Joey quoted “I Love L.A.” (Randy Newman). The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. During the drum solo by Cavs following Astroturf the rest of the band left the stage, then returned and performed a metal vamp over the end of the solo. Shanghai featured the Grow Wings and Fly “let’s get real high” jam. Ambergris featured an extended intro during which Joey and Amby contemplated the nature of sexiness. The Dripping Tap was dedicated by Amby to Cavs’ dad and to his “first music teacher who said my voice sounds weird,” and contained Cellophane teases and Hot Water teases.

Joey shouted-out other performers at the festival: Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Sam Fender, Flume, Little Simz, and Marlon Williams. Joey acknowledged that the performance was taking place on stolen land, that the band will be voting yes in the upcoming Indigenous voice to Parliament referendum, and that the audience should do the same. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Special shout out to our very own @W.B.T.G. Slinger for the recording located on Archive.org and YouTube!

The Dripping Tap contained Witchcraft quotes and Hot Water quotes.

Poster from @grape_festival‘s Instagram

The Dripping Tap contained Witchcraft quotes and Hot Water quotes.

Poster from @grape_festival‘s Instagram
Evil Death Roll contained Converge and Chang'e teases. The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. Poster By Emy Rojas

The Dripping Tap contained a The River jam with an Ice V tease. The River contained Hell's Itch teases and Wah Wah quotes/teases. Wah Wah contained The River quotes & teases. Hot Water had lyrics changed to Time to Party and contained "Everybody Needs Somebody To Love” (Solomon Burke) quotes. Gaia was unfinished. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The first tease in The River could be noted as a tease of Hell’s Itch or Chang’e, as the riffs in both songs are basically identical. It was decided that since there is no indication of what the band’s intent was, the main difference is the instrument the riff is played on. Since the riff is played on guitar in Hell's Itch and keyboard/synth in Chang'e, with the tease in question being played on guitar, it was noted as a tease of Hell's Itch. It is ruled out as the also nearly identical Witchcraft/Flamethrower riff as those songs are in minor keys, while Hell's Itch/Chang'e are in major keys and match how the tease was played in this instance.

Evil Death Roll contained Converge teases and "Animals in Australia" quotes.  Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly jam.  The vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion was performed by audience member, Axel, who was brought on stage.  Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam with lyrics.

Poster By Max Löffler

The Grim Reaper featured “I’m the Shrimp Reaper” vocals and contained quotes of Torture Chamber, Sadie Sorceress, "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) and “One, Two, Freddy’s Coming For You” (A Nightmare on Elm Street) with lyrics changed to “Shrimpy’s coming for you.” Static Electricity was introduced as a song about the time Stu almost got electrocuted in Thailand. O.N.E. contained Straws In The Wind teases. Boogieman Sam contained Rattlesnake quotes, The Bitter Boogie teases and quotes; “La Grange” (ZZ Top) teases and quotes, “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, The Dripping Tap teases, “Whole Lotta Rosie” (AC/DC) teases and “Tutti Frutti” (Little Richard) quotes. The Dripping Tap contained Hell's Itch teases and a Witchcraft jam. Poster By Job van Rijen
The Dripping Tap contained Hypertension teases. Hypertension contained Witchcraft teases. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote and Hot Water teases. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.

Boogieman Sam contained Daily Blues quotes. The Dripping Tap was dedicated to Cavs' dad who lives in Deniliquin and is an "amazing plumber." Prior to Willoughby’s Beach, which was played for the first time since 2022-04-18 (122 show gap), the band mentions they had to bring their amps from home. Joey mentions his replacement amp makes him sound like he's in The Vines and teased the intro to “Can't Stop” (Red Hot Chili Peppers). Gaia featured a Motor Spirit jam and a drum solo by Cavs. Slow Jam 1 was on the written setlist after Iron Lung and Rattlesnake was on the written setlist after Billabong Valley, but they were not performed.

Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Evil Death Roll contained Iron Lung quotes. Cut Throat Boogie contained “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) and “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes and Le Risque teases. The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases.

Following The Dripping Tap, Stu thanked sound tech Gaspard and Joey shouted out Fred Durst of Limp Bizkit, who was also playing at the fest. Danger $$$ was played for the first time since 2021-12-22. (135 show gap) The Reticent Raconteur contained an Alter Me tease. The Lord of Lightning > Cellophane segue was performed for the first time since Desert Days Festival 2018, (220 shows gap). During This Thing, Joey asked for the lights to be put on so he could take a photo for his mom, and the song itself contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote.

This show featured a new synth table setup and the debuts of Extinction and Gondii. Grace Cummings unfortunately missed a second show due to illness, and was replaced with local Berlin artist Cosey Mueller. Extinction contained a Gondii tease and Flamethrower quotes. Gondii contained Extinction teases and quotes. The Dripping Tap contained Sad Pilot teases, Motor Spirit quotes, and a Witchcraft tease. Only Parts I, II, and III of The River were performed and they contained a Motor Spirit tease, Wah Wah teases and quotes, and Extinction teases. Wah Wah contained The River teases and Extinction teases and quotes. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Before Gila Monster, the band thanks crew members Nico and Laura for building the new synth table setup at which point Cookie teases Happy Birthday. Gila Monster contained a Dragon tease. All Is Known and Rattlesnake were on the physical setlist (before and after Doom City respectively), but were cut for time. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

This show featured a new synth table setup and the debuts of Extinction and Gondii. Grace Cummings unfortunately missed a second show due to illness, and was replaced with local Berlin artist Cosey Mueller. Extinction contained a Gondii tease and Flamethrower quotes. Gondii contained Extinction teases and quotes. The Dripping Tap contained Sad Pilot teases, Motor Spirit quotes, and a Witchcraft tease. Only Parts I, II, and III of The River were performed and they contained a Motor Spirit tease, Wah Wah teases and quotes, and Extinction teases. Wah Wah contained The River teases and Extinction teases and quotes. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Before Gila Monster, the band thanks crew members Nico and Laura for building the new synth table setup at which point Cookie teases Happy Birthday. Gila Monster contained a Dragon tease. All Is Known and Rattlesnake were on the physical setlist (before and after Doom City respectively), but were cut for time. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

This show featured the debut of Raw Feel. Grace Cummings unfortunately missed a fourth show due to illness, and was replaced with Atlanta, Georgia psych-punk band Upchuck, who Joey thanked at the beginning of the show. Gamma Knife contained an intro jam and Motor Spirit teases. The Dripping Tap, which contained a Head On/Pill tease, had Stu's amp break in the middle, which lead to the song being paused for a short time during which Joey teased “Hey Joe” (Jimi Hendrix) followed by a quote from Ambrose. Nuclear Fusion featured audience member, Earl, on vocals. Honey contained a Sleep Drifter intro that contained Nuclear Fusion teases, and the song itself contained Billabong Valley, Straws In The Wind, and O.N.E teases. Straws In The Wind contained a chant of 'Free Palestine'. Venusian 2 was on the printed setlist after Perihelion but was not played. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 150

Grace Cummings returned from illness as the opening act. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam with lyrics. Boogieman Sam contained a Sad Pilot jam with lyrics, "Midnight Rambler" (The Rolling Stones) quotes, and “Boogie” (Carson) teases and quotes. The Dripping Tap was dedicated to "everyone with diarrhea" and contained a You Can Be Your Sillouhette jam and Mycelium quotes. The Wheel was dedicated to David, the band's bus driver. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Self-Immolate contained a drum solo. Following Converge, Joey shouted out opener Grace Cummings. Witchcraft was on the printed setlist after Converge, but was skipped. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100
The Dripping Tap contained a Motor Spirit tease, a You Can Be Your Silhouette tease, and a Daily Blues jam.  Robot Stop started with a small Hot Water jam and contained additional Hot Water teases.

The entire band sat in with Grace Cummings for her song "Heaven". Joey thanked Grace before the show started, and Stu mentioned that they let the crew write the setlist. Before Danger $$$, Stu mentioned Gaspard requested the song. Wah Wah contained a The River intro. Only Part I, II, and III of The River was performed and they contained Wah Wah quotes with the "wah wah" refrain changed to "boogie boogie". Road Train was requested by Andrea. Mirage City was played for Jason Galea and was played electric for the first time. Before Sad Pilot, they dedicated the song to Sammy and talked about him recording and playing pedal steel on the new album. Work This Time was dedicated to Grace Cummings. The Dripping Tap was played for Maclay Heriot and contained a Motor Spirit jam, The Silver Cord teases, and Sea of Trees teases. The intro jam to Sleep Drifter contained O.N.E, Sleep Drifter, and Honey teases. Honey contained O.N.E, If Not Now, Then When?, and Billabong Valley teases. Ambrose quoted Ain’t No Mountain High Enough (Marvin Gaye & Tammi Terrell) before Billabong Valley. Before Motor Spirit, Stu asked the crowd who was throwing dinosaurs on stage, and Ambrose quoted Deserted Dunes Welcome Weary Feet. Motor Spirit was played for Jess Lewis because "it sounds like Tool". After Dragon, the band discussed playing Am I In Heaven? but pivoted to Self-Immolate.

data.jamchart_notes: A masterclass in teasing and a very classically gizz approach to The Dripping Tap. A blissful jam opens up after the second chorus, with Antarctica teases and quotes driving the jam towards a rewarding peak. One of the greatest ways to open a tour.
data.shownotes:
This show featured the debut of Antarctica. The Dripping Tap contained Chang'e teases, You Can Be Your Silhouette teases, Antarctica teases & quotes, and Am I In Heaven? teases. Evil Death Roll was introduced as a song about Bob Dylan and contained Witchcraft and Robot Stop teases. Ice V contained a Witchcraft tease and a "Blindness" (The Fall) jam. The Fourth Colour, which was incomplete, contained a Daily Blues jam with lyrics and "Whole Lotta Rosie" (AC/DC) teases. Supercell was introduced as a song about orange juice. Following Motor Spirit, Joey introduced the band members. Gaia contained a jam with Joey on bass, which contained a Motor Spirit tease and a drum solo.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition of 650
Holographic Edition of 200

data.jamchart_notes: A long and wild jam highlights one of Stu’s now signature crowd-surfing river dips. Alternate Antarctica lyrics from Amby and a plethora of teases - notably 46 & 2 (Tool) for a large duration - soundtrack Stu’s departure and return. A closing Tap to end all closer Taps.
data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Rats In The Sky. Mars For the Rich was dedicated to Joey's friend Laura from high school who moved to Portland, Maine. This Thing contained an Incredible (M Beat) quote. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Witchcraft teases. Following Le Risque, Joey said that the song should be in Happy Gilmore 2. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Following Let Me Mend The Past, Ambrose quoted I'd Rather Go Blind (Etta James). Before The Dripping Tap, Joey shouted out opener Geese. The song itself, during which Stu was crowdsurfed to the nearby river and back, was dedicated to Bill Cavanagh and contained two Antarctica vocal jams with some of the lyrics changed to "Portland, Maine" and to being about Stu swimming in the lake nearby (some of The Dripping Tap lyrics were changed to this as well) and Sea of Trees, Head On/Pill, Witchcraft, and Alter Me teases, a Surfin' Safari (The Beach Boys) quote, as well as Joey teasing Forty Six & 2 (Tool) for a large portion of the song. Venusian 2 and Sea of Trees were on the printed setlist (before Mars For the Rich and The Dripping Tap respectively) but were not played. Poster by Jason Galea Standard Edition - 650 Foil Edition- 250

The Dripping Tap had a lyric changed to "Times of our Milwaukee" and a Le Risque quote. Hot Water contained teases of Am I In Heaven? and The Dripping Tap. God Is Calling Me Back Home was last played 2015-06-12. (580 show gap) Before The Garden Goblin, the band congratulated Cookie on the Pipe-eye single that released the night before. Magenta Mountain contained a Crumbling Castle tease. Chang'e contained Magenta Mountain teases and quotes and Witchcraft quotes. Extinction contained Magenta Mountain quotes. Billabong Valley contained Sleep Drifter teases. The intro to Honey contained Sleep Drifter teases.

Poster By Job van Rijen
Standard: 500
Gold Foil: 150

data.jamchart_notes: A blisteringly fast and wet The Dripping Tap. An intense rain storm rolled in shortly before the band took the stage, concerning Ambrose in particular as he voiced his fear for his life throughout the performance. Out of the second chorus a familiar, yet faster than usual, jam emerges. The band wastes little time re-entering the song proper with a frenetic and energetic finish. Following the song, the show was halted for 22 minutes due to torrential downpour.
data.shownotes: This show took place during an unrelenting rain storm. The Dripping Tap concluded with the Streets of Cairo tease from I'm Not In Your Mind. Following Tap the band left the stage for approximately 22 minutes due to the dangers posed by wet equipment, which was repositioned to be out of the rain during the break. Boogieman Sam contained The Bitter Boogie teases. Amby quoted Singin' In the Rain (Arthur Freed/Nacio Herb Brown) in Daily Blues. Prior to Le Risque Joey shouted out Portugal. The Man. Following The Fourth Colour, Amby quoted Can't Keep My Eyes Off Of You (Frankie Valli) with lyrics changed to "I love you Portland" and John Gourley (of Portugal. The Man) came on stage and gave the band shots. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo with a Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) tease. Supercell was introduced as a song about storms. The Lord of Lightning contained an extended outro with a Cellophane tease. The Balrog was last played 2023-03-20. (85 show gap) Poster By Jason Galea Standard: 600 Rainbow Foil: 200

This show featured the debut of Interior People, which featured Joey on acoustic guitar. I’m In Your Mind and I'm Not In Your Mind contained Cellophane teases. During I’m Not In Your Mind, Joey shouted out a young fan on his parent’s shoulders. Cut Throat Boogie contained Sad Pilot, Daily Blues and Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases. Trapdoor contained a Forty Six and 2 (Tool) tease. Before Hog Calling Contest, Joey mentioned how Ambrose invented a skate move called "Chicken to the Barnyard" and how he played Skate. During the banter, Stu put on clothes thrown in from the crowd, Joey asked who was going to the Rave Matthews Band show on Wednesday and teased “Taylor” (Jack Johnson) at which point Stu introduced the song as being by Jack Johnson. The song itself featured Joey on acoustic guitar and a pig squeal by audio tech Joe “Santo” Santarpia. Field of Vision was introduced as a song about the audience and was dedicated to Jess Lewis. Raw Feel contained Robot Stop, Witchcraft, and Third Stone From The Sun (Jimi Hendrix) teases. After the song, Joey complimented the venue, calling it “forest Red Rocks.” Ambrose quoted Le Risque before The Dripping Tap, which was dedicated to Billy Cavanaugh and contained Daily Blues, Cellophane and Magma teases and Magma quotes. Lucas referenced Pleura at the end of the show.

data.jamchart_notes: dark star style jam in the middle
data.shownotes: Mirage City was introduced as a "country song," featured Stu on acoustic guitar and contained a jam with lyrics of I’ll Be Gone (Spectrum) and a Riff Raff (AC/DC) tease. Raw Feel also featured Stu on acoustic guitar. Ice V contained Hog Calling Contest teases. Ambrose quoted the "one million dollars" line from Austin Powers and "Scotty Doesn't Know" from EuroTrip in the intro to Magma. The Dripping Tap was introduced as being sponsored by Pepto Bismol and contained You Can Be Your Silhouette and Machine Gun (Jimi Hendrix) teases. Work This Time was on the written setlist after Raw Feel but was not played.

Mr. Beat contained People-Vultures and Magma teases. Dirt and Mirage City featured Joey on acoustic guitar. Mirage City had an alternate slower outro section. Amby quoted Tomorrow (Silverchair) prior to The Dripping Tap, which contained Theia teases and quotes. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.

The Dripping Tap was unfinished. Rattlesnake contained Nuclear Fusion and Sleep Drifter teases. After Rattlesnake, Ambrose quoted an old Australian ad. Flamethrower featured a drum solo by Cavs. Extinction and Set featured the debut of the upgraded synth table (Nathan). Set contained Extinction quotes and Temporary Secretary (Paul McCartney) and The River teases. The River contained Thunderstruck (AC/DC) and Sad Pilot teases.

Am I In Heaven? contained Antarctica and Hypertension teases. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo. Dragon featured a fan named Ignas on Stu’s guitar instead of Stu. After Dragon, Joey wished Stu a happy Pink Soup Day (a local festival in Vilnius about beet soup). Billabong Valley contained a See Me quote. Stu said "Fuck Putin" during Pleura. Le Risque was introduced as being called "Pink Soup", to which the band started chanting "Pink Soup", and Joey vocally teased Kernkraft 400 (Zombie Nation). The song itself featured a fan dressed as Evel Knievel on stage during Ambrose's verse, who Stu thanked after the song. Down The Sink was played for the first time since 2023-08-30 (76 show gap), in a new alternate synthpop arrangement, and contained Gilgamesh quotes. As Gilgamesh ended, Joey compared the band's synth playing at the end of the jam to Rammstein. Joey and Cavs teased Blind (Korn) before Trapdoor. The Dripping Tap featured Stu telling a story about him and Joey getting pink soup and how it was the best thing they had ever eaten, with Joey playing his guitar with his teeth because he "spilled pink soup on it", and contained a Tool jam featuring elements and variations of Forty Six & 2 and Schism with Motor Spirit quotes. After The Dripping Tap, Joey said "Free Palestine," "Glory to Ukraine" (from a sign in the audience) and "humanity."

This show featured the debut of Smoke & Mirrors. The Dripping Tap contained a Chang'e and Head On/Pill tease and an Antarctica vocal tease. Before Flight b741, the band talked about the clouds at the venue, and Joey quoted Field of Vision, and Stu referenced The Land Before Time. Intrasport was played without the synth table. Sense was played in an alternate synth version for the first time. During Grim Reaper, which contained "Black Market Bargain" lyrics and Get Low (Lil Jon) and H.O.O.D. (Kneecap) quotes. Amby called out, "are you not entertained?" in reference to Gladiator. Only Ambrose's verses of Smoke & Mirrors were performed, and the song contained The Grim Reaper teases. Gaia and Gila Monster ended in a drum solos. Before Inner Cell, Stu teased Loyalty.

This show featured the debut of Phantom Island, Deadstick, Lonely Cosmos, Eternal Return, Panpsych, Spacesick, Aerodynamic, Sea of Doubt, and Silent Spirit and was played with The Chamber Orchestra of Philadelphia conducted by Sarah Hicks. During Grow Wings and Fly, which contained Am I In Heaven? teases, Stu thanked the venue, The Chamber Orchestra of Philadelphia, and Sarah Hicks. The Dripping Tap contained Am I In Heaven? teases and was performed without The Chamber Orchestra of Philadelphia. Only parts I, II, and IV of The River were played. Crumbling Castle was played with the outro (without vocals) for the first time. The Dripping Tap was not on the printed setlist, but it and the jam following Grow Wings and Fly functioned as a setbreak for the orchestra.
data.soundcheck: The River, Crumbling Castle, Dragon, Iron Lung, This Thing, Mars For The Rich

data.shownotes: The band dressed in drag for the third annual drag night. Theia, Sad Pilot, Most Of What I Like, and Aerodynamic were performed acoustic. Theia contained The River and The Land Before Timeland teases. Most Of What I Like contained Praise You (Fatboy Slim) teases and was dedicated by Joey to his wife Edith. Aerodynamic was played for the first time without an orchestra. Before Venusian 1, the band said if they should have soundchecked it and joked that if they messed it up, they would play Stoned Mullet instead. Following Venusian 1, Joey quoted Chop Suey (System of a Down) and Lucas shouted out festival act Yvie Oddly. Her and I (Slow Jam 2) contained You Can Be Your Silhouette, Am I In Heaven?, The River, Blindness (The Fall), Crumbling Castle, and Monkey Disco (Babe Rainbow) teases. Following Her and I, the band announced that the festival would be played again next year, and shouted out their manager Michelle Cable and the fans at the festival. O.N.E. was introduced as Duran Duran's favorite song. Before Billabong Valley, Joey mentioned Australian rapper RAED. During The Silver Cord, Stu vamped on the lyrics "let's get fucked up" and "everybody wants to save us." Following Daily Blues, Ambrose quoted Scarface (Push It to the Limit) (Paul Engemann). Float Along - Fill Your Lungs was dedicated to Matt Gawiak, a fan that passed away during the show night 1 of the festival and contained a Dragon jam. Ambrose led the crowd in a chant of 'Matt' following Float Along - Fill Your Lungs. The Dripping Tap was also dedicated to Matt Gawaik. Rats In The sky was on the printed setlist after The Garden Goblin but was skipped.

Joey said "Fuck Peter Dutton" during the intro of Pleura. Before Magma Joey shouted "Light 'em up, T!" then said that he's always wanted to say that in Australia. Field of Vision contained a quote of Wipeout (The Surfaris).  Dirt was played for the first time since 2024-11-16 (50 show gap) and was played all electric for the first time. During The Dripping Tap, which contained Magma, Machine Gun (Jimi Hendrix) and Cellophane teases, Stu’s amp broke so Joey told a story while another amp was brought out. After Witchcraft, Cavs performed a drum solo while the rest of the band took a break, followed by Cavs taking his own break. The Mind Fuzz suite was introduced as a song by Jimi Hendrix called I'm In Your Mind Fuzz.  I'm Not In Your Mind contained Trapdoor, Machine Gun (Jimi Hendrix) and The Dripping Tap teases.
